intro: Corydalis namdoensis, commonly known as the Namdo larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
